news.title: Secrecy Sleeves and the “Naked Ballot”
news.description: At least 16 states will provide inner envelopes to absentee voters to protect their privacy in the November election. States diverge on whether ballots without secrecy sleeves will count.

news.title: Ballot Drop-Off Options in All 50 States
news.description: This resource describes the availability of ballot drop boxes in each state and identifies the locations where voters can drop off completed ballots before and on Election Day.

news.title: Ruling Against Yelp in S.F. Court Bars Recording Either Side of Phone Conversation Without Both Parties’ Consent
news.description: According to a state appeals court judge, California privacy law requires all the participants in a conversation to consent to recording, even if only one participant is being recorded.

news.title: New Jury Instructions Strengthen Social Media Cautions
news.description: A federal judiciary committee has provided an updated set of model jury instructions to federal judges to help them warn jurors against using social media to research or discuss cases.

news.title: California Bar Exam Takers Say Facial Recognition Software Rejected Them
news.description: Many non-white test takers have said that they were forced to shine lights in their faces or submit selfies to enter various sections of the exam after the software rejected them.

news.title: When AI Hurts People, Who Is Held Responsible?
news.description: A UCLA law school professor has published a paper arguing that artificial intelligence creates tension with the traditional legal theory of negligence and requires intervention by regulators.
